findings.title: Minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens
findings.description: The mint function allows an unlimited number of tokens to be created without any restriction.

findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The smart contract may allow an unauthorized user to upgrade the script, potentially leading to malicious code execution.

findings.title: Rebase function can adjust circulating token supply automatically according to set parameters
findings.description: The rebase function allows automatic adjustment of circulating token supply based on set parameters.

findings.title: Use of rebase function may lead to unintended consequences
findings.description: The internal rebase function can cause unintended consequences if not used properly.

findings.title: Centralization Risk
findings.description: Active contract ownership identified, which can lead to centralization risks such as rug pull scams.

findings.title: Unprotected functions: mint, burn, swap, skim, sync, initialize
findings.description: The contract has unprotected functions that can be accessed by anyone, potentially leading to unauthorized state changes.

findings.title: Unprotected approve and transfer functions
findings.description: The approve and transfer functions are unprotected, allowing unauthorized access to manipulate allowances and token transfers.

findings.title: Use of external libraries and interfaces (e.g. IPancakeSwapRouter)
findings.description: The contract uses external libraries and interfaces such as IPancakeSwapFactory, Ownable, ERC20Detailed, and SafeMathInt which can pose a security risk if not properly validated.
